WRITING.TEXT: I had the opportunity to tour this facility when I was stationed in Alaska. It's not too far outside of Fairbanks and there is a lot of aurora activity at that lattitude so that's why it's in Alaska. Also the University of Alaska Fairbanks campus is fairly close. There is a sweet spot in the lattitude range where too far north the activity tapers off and too far south same thing. Anyway, the rockets don't go into orbit, they launch them in an arcing trajectory to fly through the aurora and take readings then they fall back to earth where they recover them down range to the north east if I remember correctly.

No. There are only a few websites that talk about this guy and they all seem to stem from this one that I found: https://www.nationstates.net/nation=the_divine_empire_of_oranienburg/detail=factbook/id=247350
This site said he was awarded the Knight's Cross of the Iron Cross with Oak Leaves, Swords, and Diamonds. This is not true. There were only 27 awarded and the list can be found here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Knight's_Cross_of_the_Iron_Cross_recipients
Also if you look at a listing of the top snipers of all time the highest number is 505 by Simo Hyh: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_snipers
Of course, wikipedia is not a peer reviewed historical reference but there is nothing else out there to substantiate NationStates.net claim. The Nazi's were known for their grandiose use of propaganda and this may have been one of their tall tales.

Not sure how far you want to drive but there really isn't much around Wichita Falls. I'm in Fort Worth and there really isn't that much good hiking here either. If you feel like driving you can check out Guadalupe NP out by El Paso or Caprock Canyon state park over by Amarillo. Also around Mena Arkansas is really nice and tons of trails.

I lived in Kaiserslautern Germany for 4 years and there are lots of old castle ruins and Celtic burial mounds along with Franco-Prussian war battlefields and bomb craters from WWII. There is a very well marked and maintained network of hiking trails that go all over that whole area. Here is a German website with some maps: https://www.kaiserslautern.de/tourismus_freizeit_kultur/tourismus/gruen_und_aktiv/wandern/rundwanderwege/index.html.de

Yea I was a little worried about his penchant to shoot his mouth off and say things that would get the US in trouble but there are checks and balances in place to moderate or even impeach him if he goes too far. He is a smart guy but has a few personality flaws but nobody is perfect. He makes for great entertainment also which has drawn so many people into politics such as myself who never gave two shits. I have always felt my vote didn't count so why bother until this time. I did my research to see where each candidate stood on topics that mattered to me and Trump more closely fit than Hillary.

Ok so I have never voted before because I felt that my vote would not matter in the state of Texas because they pretty much always voted republican in the past and that party is the one that I am more aligned with. This election was different, the polls were very close and I could not sit and let the vote go to Hillary which in my opinion would mean an extension of what Obama was trying to do with health care. I know a few people personally who could not afford the Obama care so they were left without coverage and had to pay the fine with their tax return. I am hoping Trump will be able to do something for these people who slipped through the cracks. I'm not worried about illegal aliens, they have been here all along and there really isn't much that can be done to stop them. As far as improving the economy is concerned, in Texas the economy seems to be doing great, I have a job and I don't personally know of anyone looking for a job that really wants one. I use LinkedIn and see jobs all over the place. Bottom line, I had to stop Hillary from furthering Obamas policies.

I was stationed in Germany for 4 years and recycling is mandatory for everyone. They have different color bags to put stuff in and separate days for the trucks to run. You had to take your glass to the recycle bin yourself and sort it by color...that was my favorite part, smashing all those jars.

From what I have read about it sugar makes your insulin levels spike which triggers your body to store fat when it otherwise wouldn't. If you eat a 100 calorie slice of watermelon vs a 100 calorie slice of pizza the watermelon will cause a bigger insulin response compared to the same calorie pizza slice. Now you can mitigate the insulin spike by eating a handful of peanuts or something else low on the index if you want to eat sugary foods. The problem with saying there are better options out there now is what are they? It's easy to say there something is wrong without providing an alternate way. I'm not saying what I'm talking about is right just let's hear some alternatives to help this guy out.

Not sure about the sore leg thing, maybe try some other cardio equipment and see what happens. For me I do a combination of things and none involve a treadmill. I think treadmills beat you up too much but I'm old so I use the elliptical, spin bike and rowing machine along with some calisthenics. Remember, the goal is to burn more calories than you consume and do some reading on eating food based on the glycemic index. I'm no fitness expert so anyone feel free to throw in some ideas.
